definition: to ask sb to resign from a post
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: At 8pm last night， Mr Leung formally submitted his resignation to the chief executive.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚八时，梁锦松正式向特首请辞。

sentences.english: Mr Tung disclosed that Mrs Ip had submitted her resignation on June 25.
sentences.chinese: 董特首透露叶局长早于六月二十五日已向他请辞。

definition: (written) resignation
to take the blame/to accept responsibility (for a mistake)
to resign from office/to dismiss from office
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
to resign/to quit
to leave office
to resume a post
to resign a government post
to admit responsibility and resign
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to apologize humbly/to beg forgiveness
to put forward a suggestion (to sb in a senior position)/to offer a word of advice
